2025-08-01.history: St. Alphonsus Liguori (1696–1787) was an Italian bishop and founder of the Redemptorists. He was a lawyer before becoming a priest and is known for his writings on moral theology.
2025-08-01.reflection: Lord, help me to follow St. Alphonsus in seeking holiness not through pride but through humility and service.

2025-08-04.history: St. John Vianney (1786–1859), known as the Curé of Ars, was a French parish priest renowned for his pastoral care and his devotion to the Sacrament of Reconciliation.
2025-08-04.reflection: God, grant me the patience and love St. John Vianney showed to sinners, that I too may lead others to You.

2025-08-15.history: The Assumption of Mary celebrates the belief that the Blessed Virgin was taken body and soul into heavenly glory at the end of her earthly life.
2025-08-15.reflection: Mary, assumed into heaven, guide my heart toward the things that are eternal.

2025-09-03.history: St. Gregory the Great (540–604) was pope and Doctor of the Church. He reformed the liturgy, supported missionaries, and is associated with Gregorian chant.
2025-09-03.reflection: Lord, through St. Gregory’s intercession, may I use my gifts to serve both the Church and the poor.

2025-09-21.history: St. Matthew was a tax collector called by Jesus to be an Apostle. He is the author of the Gospel of Matthew.
2025-09-21.reflection: Jesus, like Matthew, I too am called out of my ordinary life to follow You more deeply.
